social_posts.post_text:
I’m about to go lay down. Y’all be good. 

See you on the flip. 🙏🏾💜✨

Had to tap back in for a moment to say thank you to my friend @trevornoah not just for the shout out but for doing the righteous job he’s done at @thedailyshow 

Remember how worried people were that no one could fill Jon Stewart’s shoes? Trevor came in with sneakers on like “I don’t need those shoes!” He came and created his own space and did it with integrity, intellectual curiosity and the kind of natural humor that’s just irresistible. 

Also, Black women get so little credit for the labor we put in day in and out. I can’t tell you how good it feels to hear unsolicited, freely given love for our contributions. 

You a real one my dude. Stay up! 💜

Last night the historic city of SELMA, ALABAMA was devastated by a tornado causing massive damage. Thankfully many lives were spared but the city, which is already in one of the poorest counties in the nation, is completely wrecked. If you’ve ever celebrated the sacrifices made by the people in Selma or better yet commemorated the victories won in the historic city - now is the time to show your gratitude. They will need a lot of support in the coming weeks and months to recover from this devastation. Please be ready to help. Remember Selma.

For folks asking for information on how to help in Selma. This is another credible source to send support to help in the rebuilding of Selma. Please help spread the word. 

Three days out and folks STILL have no electricity and are out of their homes. There will be drives for clothes and other household items soon. Stay tuned. 

#RememberSelma

One of the things Dr. King did best was use the power of the people to make massive moves…Selma, the historical city where he helped to make history that we all benefit from today…needs our help. The Tornado that devastated the city last week has left many of the citizens, already dealing with low wealth and resources, in critical situations. Please do what you can to support Selma even if it’s helping to spread the word. 

#RememberSelma

H/T @arraynow for the beautiful assets 💚

I’d like to invite you to an extraordinary online event kicking off Black History Month —the Afrikan Wisdom Summit. 

I am excited to be a speaker for this special event…

Join me and 40 more presenters for powerful conversations of liberation, inspiration and transformation for everyone, plus watch an outstanding collection of seven films curated by the Silicon Valley African Film Festival.

This online Summit is free for you to attend…

Presenters also include: Rev. Michael Beckwith, founder of Agape International Spiritual Center, Resmaa Menakem, New York Times bestselling author of the groundbreaking book My Grandmother’s Hands, Mungi Ngomane , human rights activist and granddaughter of Archbishop Desmond Tutu, and many more…

Everyone is welcome and encouraged to attend this remarkable event, and benefit from the wisdom that will be shared.

Register through my link at: 

https://www.afrikanwisdomsummit.com/aws/Tarana+Burke+AWS+2023/

Sometimes a hope.
Sometimes a prayer. 
Sometimes a frustration. 
Sometimes a fear. 
Sometimes impossible. 

#tyrenichols #werehereagain

It was such an honor to sit with my girl Gabrielle Union to chat about her new role on this season of @truthbetold on @appletv and her ongoing role as advocate for survivors and homegirl to her legion of fans! 
Hope you all enjoy!

Gabrielle Union holds nothing back in our February cover story interview with @taranajaneen. The ‘Truth Be Told’ actress candidly chatted about her career, marriage, motherhood, and the most difficult chapters of her life while filming Season 3 of the Apple TV+ series. 

Her strength and vulnerability shines through every word, reminding us of the power of authenticity and courage. Thank you Gabrielle, for sharing with #HelloBeautiful.

Can’t let the day slip away without sending love to my LITTLE BROTHER who is officially *37* today (if you believe in that sort of thing - I don’t. He’s actually in middle school 🙂) 

I love you, Malcaroni 💚

Join me and my bday twin tonight as we talk all things self-care…even how we don’t get it right sometimes 😩

Tonight at 7PM!

On this #Internationalwomensday I am grateful for the posts and acknowledgments that I’ve received today for work past and recent years but I want to lift up the women on whose shoulders I stand. These are the women so many are quick to call ‘regla’ but I’ve yet to meet many regular Black women - and definitely few in my family and extended family and friend circles. These women, like my mother and grandmother, who have taught me as much about empathy as they did about resilience. And my aunt and great aunt who taught me as much about joy as they have about strength. These are the women who scraped and sacrificed and bent but didn’t break so I had the freedom to break and rebuild over and over again until I became the version of myself that can be celebrated today. 

I am a woman because I know those ‘regla’ women. So please don’t just scroll through your social media pages today posting and praising certain women. All that identify deserve a nod today because this thing ain’t easy and no one is out here alone…💜

#Repost @metoomvmt
・・・
When we frame sexual violence as a public health crisis, we acknowledge that sexual violence is a systemic issue, compounded by racial, social, economic, and environmental factors. Knowing #WhatsAtStake demands that we be insistent on government and public institutions to meet us exactly where we are. This #SAAM2023, we are holding them responsible for prioritizing survivors and creating adequate responses that address, disrupt and prevent further harm. Join us today: visit our website www.metooMVMT.org/whatsatstake

HAPPY BIRTHDAY CAMIKA!!!

The people’s champ. The Floacist. Smarty-Art. The sharpest knife in the draw. My manz and ‘nem. My sista! 

Love you girl. 💜

@drcamikaroyal

ALL HANDS ON DECK!! * FROM:
@leemerrittesq @attorneycrump
16 year old #RalphYarl was going to pick up his two younger siblings from an unfamiliar address when he was shot in the head and again while on the ground by the white man that answered the door after he rang the
wrong door bell.
Ralph is a junior in High School. He loves music and plays the bass clarinet. He is loved by his family and community and he has a bright bright future. He didn't deserve what happened to him. We won't stand for it. We are coming for justice.
Use the contact information below to demand Prosecutor Zachary Thompson make an immediate arrest and bring the appropriate charges:
Building: James S. Rooney Justice Center
Address:
11 South Water Street
Liberty, Missouri 64068
Telephone: 816-736-8300
Fax: 816-736-8301
Email: prosecutor@claycopa.com

While I’m glad that this latest move by #Desantis is getting some attention across mainstream and social media it isn’t the LEAST bit shocking. What’s shocking is when people tell me that #metoo has nothing to do with #Dobbs and the overturn of Roe v Wade when across the country the most EGREGIOUS portions of these anti-abortion laws are the lack of exceptions for survivors of rape and incest. Even children. 

Sexual Violence is a social justice issue not fodder for the gossip columns. Every 68 seconds there is an act of sexual violence happening in America. That’s a crisis by definition. This is a public health crisis that we cannot allow our leadership to play political football with at the expense of the safety, health and wholeness of our communities. THAT is why #metoo is a movement. @metoomvmt #metoo 
#survivorjusticeisreproductivejustice

As a survivor of CSA (child sex abuse) this enrages me. As a mother, auntie, youth worker, citizen, leader and human Im outraged. This is what’s at stake if we let these people win. There are enough survivors out here to swing an election in any direction we want - whenever we wanted to. They just don’t think we are organized enough to do it. But they always underestimate us don’t they? #metoo #metooMVMT #survivorjusticeisreproductivejustice #survivorsVOTE

Sad and grateful. 

I don’t have a lot of words at the moment but those two rise to the top immediately. I’m about 29 in this picture. I’m 49 now. I’m grateful for the time and lessons and love and laughter and kindness (and scolding, lol). 

It was rare air. Rest well, giant.
Coming this fall. 💐💜

It’s a whole holiday!! #MAIDAY

I’ve said before and I’ll say again - you don’t know anyone like @maorikarmael The Magnificent ✨

Happy Birthday Mai, may you have all the abundance that you shower the world with returned to you tenfold. 

Love you to the moon! 💜🫶🏾

Joseph Burke. My granddaddy. 
He would be 96 today. 

It’s been 30 years since we lost him.

Until this day no man has had a greater influence on my life.

He’s the best man I’ve ever known, save one. 

He wrapped me in RBG from a baby and set my course. I’m forever grateful. 

Family, community, righteousness, strength, dignity, and loyalty are the first things the come to mind when I think of him. 

Love you forever ❤️🖤💚

We three. 💜💜💜

My mommy and the one who made me a mommy. 

#mothersday

I’m so grateful to @msteresayounger and the Ms Foundation for allowing me to honor my sister @mslatoshabrown as she received a 2023 Women of Vision Award. 

We went back to our roots and pulled out a 21C song “I Want to Lift My Sister Up” to flip the script and fill the room with voices of Love for Latosha this time around. It was magical. ✨

I love you, sis. 💜

social_posts.post_text:
CALLING THE BRONX AND BALTIMORE!! 🗣️🗣️🗣️🗣️

How many wonders can one theater hold? 

Find out this Sunday at a free screening of the live action Little Mermaid! I’m teaming up with #1Billion4BlackGirls to offer tickets at two locations: 

		The AMC White Marsh 16 in Baltimore, MD at 3pm on Sunday, June 4

		The AMC Bay Plaza theater in the Bronx, NY at 4pm on Sunday, June 4

You can pick up tickets at the box office of either theater before their showtimes and enjoy the show, on us! We encourage youth attendance at the screenings.

***Special gifts and prizes for the kiddies!!!***

(Limited seats and quantities)

WE DID IT!!!! 

This past Sunday with the support of the @blackgirlfreedomfund and the #1billion4blackgirls initiative we bought out TWO theaters in my beloved borough THE BRONX and in Baltimore, MD! 

Every movie goer received a Little Mermaid book and a bunch of the kids got gifts and prizes including the Halle Bailey Ariel Doll and other little mermaid dolls and toys. It was magical!! ✨✨✨

Our babies deserve this joy. 💜

Thank you to all who came out and joined us and to the volunteers who supported us!

I have shared the new tool called Survivor Sanctuary with you all before - now I’m asking that you help me spread the word about this amazing tool. It’s a virtual healing experience for survivors at any phase in their healing journey. It’s meant to provide guidance for folks who are looking to begin, deepen or restart their quest for post traumatic growth. 

Please share this post and tag @metoomvmt -  and while you’re at it you might want to follow our page 😊
Thank you! 

The most beautiful thing about the Survivor’s Sanctuary is that it has something for everyone and it makes no assumptions about what each user knows or doesn’t know. You can start and stop as often as you need to and pick up right where you left off because, you, the survivor, are in control of your journey. It’s not meant to replace any other work you might be doing - only enhance it. And if you aren’t doing any other work at the moment it can provide you a gentle introduction into the what deeper work might look like for you. 

We invite all survivors to come the Sanctuary this summer. I hope you find something that speaks to what you need. 

❤️✊🏾

Shout out to my dude this Father’s Day. Watching him work hard to be the best father he can be has been so healing to my single mother soul. After doing it alone (and with my village) for so long it’s breathtaking to see him and other brothers in my circle work at being active, present dads. Thinking about the dads who step up and step in this Father’s Day. My personal experience is actually more of an anomaly because the men in my family like grandaddy, uncles, cousins and brothers and the men in my community like my chosen brothers are all amazing fathers - even if not in the nuclear sense - and I’m grateful for their example.

Dear Whit, 

I wanted to post different pictures today so I sat here for about thirty minutes shuffling through the hundreds of pictures we have from almost a decade a half of shenanigans in love, friendship and sisterhood. As I combed through all these pictures remembering the laughter, travels, adventures and fun I also sat here trying to picture what these years would have been without you and I absolutely can’t. Time and distance and life change things but nothing changes the fact that I’m glad you were born and I’m glad you were so stank to me that day on the street in Harlem and I’m even more glad that we got to spin the block and become real life friends and family. You are my forever person. Happy Birthday @ovonion 

I love you! 💜

This year’s WORLD ATHLETICS 100M Championship in Budapest will go down in history. 

Three of the fastest women to ever run racing each other. 
A legend (Fraser-Pryce). A protege (Jackson). A comeback (Richardson). And an underdog (Talou)

This is the stuff track dreams are made of. And you know what? As excited as I am about the win…I honestly got misty eyed at the embraces at the end. Those were real, sister athlete to sister athlete embraces. It’s the part I always loved about track. Leave it on the track. 

Sooo excited for the Olympics in Paris!! 👊🏾🙌🏾🏃🏾‍♀️

Celebrating one of my favorite humans in the world today…my fine ass auntie! 

Happy Birthday to you!! 🤩🥰😍

Love you to the moon and back!

Happy Birthday to my sister, my friend, my forever fave. 

The ‘way with words’ and the wit  that’ll make you watch ya self. 

🐐🤩❤️🔥

I’ll remind y’all every year so you can be in practice when it’s a National Holiday. 

#ImaniPerryDay 
#goshawtyitsyourbirthday

I know it’s after midnight but I haven’t felt like talking about my birthday until now….

I thought I’d wake up with the words falling into my hands as often happens on the 12th but they didn’t come. In fact I was a little down this morning. Couldn’t get a handle on why. I’m extremely happy to see another year and I’ve been looking forward to this one for a while because today is my 50th birthday. 

I knew I’d bring it in with a bang with loved ones and friends. I knew I’d be reflective and contemplative. But I didn’t know how I would actually feel waking up at 6AM on the day until I did and the feeling was unexplainable. 

And then I saw this picture. 

My mother posted a photo I have no memory of from when I was a newborn. I’m three weeks old. In five decades I don’t recall seeing me that young . Suddenly, i wanted to tell that baby everything. I wanted to tell her that bad things were coming and that she will be brave and scared but not to worry because those can be the same thing. I wanted to tell her that leaving at the first lie is okay. But don’t hate yourself because you left at the fortieth. I wanted to whisper in her ear “no one will ever know how beautiful you are as much as you and your mirror so only ever listen to the two of them.” I wanted to tell her that “loud” and “bossy” and even “Ms. Know-it-all” is going to pay off in spades BIG one day. Just take the detention on the chin. I wanted to tattoo “you’re doing a good job” on one little wrist and “go get some rest” on the other so the understanding could grow with her. I wanted to hum “Be A Lion” in her ear now so she has the melody when the anxiety comes. I wanted to lay with her and look at her and assure her that just like the month before at the ‘Back to Scool’ party not to far from here where there was something else born that would be strong, creative, ever evolving, resilient, brilliant and historic…the Bronx keeps creating it and she was born to turn the world right side up. 

…and she’s not finished. 

#1973Baby
#BronxNationalist
#HipHopBaby
#BirthdayGirl

Join me, Dr. @imaniperry, and @taranajaneen in conversation tomorrow evening. We’ll be discussing the legacy of Ntozake Shange and the recently released collection of her unpublished works edited by Dr. Perry with a foreword by Tarana Burke. Register now!
Link in @wibookfest bio (and my Stories)

Repost from @wibookfest
•
The #WiBookFest is honored to host Dr. Yaba Blay in conversation with Imani Perry and Tarana Burke, as they present a never-before-seen posthumous collection of Ntozake Shange’s unpublished poems, essays, and plays for SING A BLACK GIRL'S SONG! 

Infused with humor, sadness, joy, and projections of a better future, Shange exemplifies not only the breadth of the Black experience in America, but of the human experience as a whole. For every Black woman drowning in feelings of self-doubt, lovelessness, and victimhood, Shange used her prose to provide love and healing. ❤

Register now for this virtual event at 7 p.m. on September 20! Link in our bio

SURPRISE #StreetYouGrewUpOn fans!!!! The Boogie Down Bronx is a huge part of who I am. And I talk a lot about growing up there in #ThickerThanWater so I couldn’t be on this tour stop (so close to the street I grew up on) without talking about these Bronx streets. And who better to interview me than our season one guest, and fellow BX native @taranajaneen. The @kipsbaybgc is, in a lot of ways, where my once upon a time began. It’s where I discovered acting, met amazing friends and learned life lessons that are still deeply engrained in me today. I’m so excited to share this special LIVE episode of #StreetYouGrewUpOn with you all to kick off this season. Link in bio to watch!!!!!!

All hall the QUEEN…👑

…and I mean royalty. A monarch. Wise and empathetic in her leadership. Strategic and skilled in her movements. Bold and authoritative all the while loving, compassionate and guiding. 

She reigns supreme. 

With love. And is loved. Always. Forever. 

Happy Birthday Mommy 💜💜💜💜

****TONIGHT****
Join @advancementproject, @alliance4ed, @nationalwomenslawcenter, @splcenter, @inournames, @interruptcrim Wednesday, October 18 at 6 PM ET for #SafeNotSexualized virtual event with me, Andrea Ritchie, researchers, and survivors about school police sexual violence. 

Over the past three years, all six organizations have collected data and engaged young people in community conversations about their experiences with school policing and the pervasive, structural, but often invisible problem, of sexual harassment, assault, and violation of students by police or security guards in their schools. We have come together to uplift the collective resilience of young people and challenge the structures that make this violence possible.

To RSVP and join the conversation on our findings and calls to action, check out the link in my bio. #PoliceFreeSchools
null

I’m so excited to bring two of my passions together! I serve on the Board of @blackvotersmtr and of course my organization @metoomvmt 

Survivors are a constituency. And since Black women experience the second highest rate of sexual violence in this country AND are some of the most fervent voters in the country…It only follows that we have work to do together to both amplify the needs of survivors and keep our communities safe.

Link in Bio for full article

Celebrating what would have been my grandma’s 94th Birthday today. 

Smiling through my tears remembering how much joy she was filled with and how much joy she brought to us all!

Happy Birthday Grandma 🍰💜✨
Love you, forever.

“The horrors of war cannot justify the use of sexual violence as a means of warfare, and it is our collective responsibility and mission to advocate for the eradication of this suffering and continue the fight toward a more equitable world for all, regardless of sex, race, nationality or class.” 

Please see the link in my bio for the full statement. 

 #Ceasefire #Palestine #Israel #Sudan #Congo #Ukraine #Tigray #SurvivorJustice

We are clear that the acts of gender-based violence that we are seeing across the globe in places like Israel, Palestine, Sudan, Congo, and Tigray are why we continue to raise our voices for survivor justice. 

Read our full updated statement via the link in my bio.

Today is my favorite day of the year…

It’s my BABY’s (who is not a baby anymore) BIRTHDAY!!

Happy 26th Birthday to the absolute love of my life… Kaia my Papaya 💜

I love you so much my baby. 🤩

Happy Birthday to my friend girl, aka Yableezy, aka Shenanigans McGilucutty, aka Cap’t No Behavior 

My Makidada 💜

Love ya, girl!

Happiest of Birthdays to my beloved. 
Can’t believe how many rotations around the sun I’ve seen you through. Can’t believe I get to spend so many more with you. 💜

Love you 😘

*boots from @iamjenniferle 🤩

Today marks the 38th anniversary of the release of the original film The Color Purple - December 18, 1985. 
As we all prepare for the theatrical release of the new @thecolorpurple movie on Christmas Day I have to take a moment to honor the original. If you know me (and my sister @yabablay) you already know how much this film and book mean to me. There are few literary and definitely no film more important to me. With the new film coming out the original has been playing quite a bit lately. Although I have watched it so many times a deep wave of gratitude came over me recently. As I watched @desretajackson and @akosuabusia in their roles as Celie and Nettie I was so deeply grateful for how long we had been living with their images in our mind and body and spirit. We have had these little Black girls captured in our hearts and grown with them for nearly 40 years. And even though the roles were tough and sad - they were not unlike the lives of a lot of us in some ways. And we had @margaretshugavery and @oprah and our beloved @whoopigoldberg on top of that and I think I’ve taken for granted what a gift it has been for a little Black girl to live with these images in real life that brought this story to life that has held me in so many ways. I’m grateful. 

And now a new generation will have them! I can’t wait to witness it. And I’m so grateful that it is @tasiasword and @daniebb3 and @phyliciapearl and @hallebailey among others to carry on that tradition. How fortunate are these babies. 

This purple legacy endures. 💜

#makidada

Servant Leader || Girl's Advocate || Founder & CVO of the @metoomvmt || The Hell and the High Water || Bx Nationalist 🙅🏾‍♀️ || a Warrior
